programme.title: Brice Garnett Wins 2024 Puerto Rico Open

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The star-studded final table of the $1,500 Stud would see WSOP bracelet winners Men Nguyen, Ted Forrest, and Minh Nguyen looking to add more WSOP gold to their trophy case. Chad Brown would be eyeing his first WSOP bracelet as $111,440 in first-place prize money was up for grabs.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Nearly 800 rebuys would take this field size to 1,334 and a prize pool of over $1.26 million. The final table would be stacked with tournament veterans led by Daniel Negreanu, John Juanda, Mike Matusow, Lee Markholt, Paul Phillips, and Ram Vaswani as all eyes were on the $365,900 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The 831-entrant field created a $1.14 million prize pool in the first $1,500 No-Limit Hold'em event of the 2004 WSOP. Poker author Blair Rodman, and tournament regulars Joe Awada, Scott Epstein, and Kent Washington held seats at the final table, along with "The Crew" member Scott Fischman as the $300,000 first-place prize was up for grabs.

programme.desc: Watch the Event #8: $25,200 No-Limit Hold'em final table from the 2024 Poker Masters.

programme.title: Swept
programme.desc: Buried secrets come to light and new relationships develop when five old friends reconnect at their 20-year high school reunion.

programme.title: Cooperating Criminals

Now, Tony faces a stark choice: witness or prison.

programme.title: Intrigue
programme.desc: Jessica and Darren's marriage has hit a rocky stage in their lives. When a mysterious man named Michael enters her life, Jessica is intrigued explores options that could have deadly consequences.

programme.title: The Last Days of an Escort
programme.desc: Kitty, a struggling escort, agrees to be documented for a film. Her roommate, Star, a more successful escort, reluctantly joins. A new client, Earl, changes their lives forever when he asks to see Kitty and Star together. Kitty's world becomes increasingly dangerous as she navigates the dark underworld of escorting.

programme.title: Counteract
programme.desc: Amateur and immature social media influencer, Sylvia Shaw has set out to aide her struggling family from financial ruin. Doing so, she is lured into working for a mysterious company that promises fame and great wealth. But soon realizes, her new employer is a mystery, for many reasons.

programme.title: Teacher's Pet
programme.desc: A young man and his teacher enter into an inappropriate relationship with deadly consequences.

programme.title: Hoodie Girls Gang
programme.desc: Kayla's boyfriend Jamal is jailed and needs $10,000 bail. Desperate, Kayla and her friends plan an armed robbery. However, the heist goes wrong, and the police are on their trail. To make matters worse, Jamal's boss, Sean, demands payment for the drugs Jamal was transporting. Kayla must now free Jamal and escape town before both the police and Sean catch up to her.

programme.title: Mistress for Hire
programme.desc: Skylar works as a professional mistress hired by women for divorce leverage. When she finds herself falling for her target, Eric, she questions her career and her motives. But when Eric's wife, Octavia, won't allow Skylar to destroy her plans, and a dangerous game of cat and mouse ensues, with love and survival on the line.

programme.title: Curfew: Sins of the Father

His involvement leads to a love triangle and ultimately a betrayal. Now, haunted by his past, Thomas must confront the consequences when his son, Christian, becomes a target of the crime boss's revenge.

programme.title: The Wait Game

Their idyllic relationship takes a terrifying turn when a home intruder invades their peaceful sanctuary. Held captive in her own home, Yolanda is confronted with a shocking revelation that will forever alter the course of their lives.

programme.desc: Things go from bad to worse when a philandering man with blood on his hands discovers his fiancée is pregnant.

Can Tex escape his shady past and finally end his mission of vengeance?

But ranch owner Logan Maury proves to be a more than formidable opponent. He'll stop at nothing, including murder, to turn the farmers' fields into grazing grounds for his cattle.

programme.desc: Ventriloquist and stand-up comedian Jeff Dunham performs an all-Valentine's Day-themed special.

programme.desc: Jeff and his felt friends Walter, Melvin the Superhero Guy, Peanut, and others share their latest and greatest thoughts about our times.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: Unhinged in Hollywood
programme.desc: The comedian and his puppets perform in the gorgeous Dolby Theatre, featuring hilarious sketches with surprise guests and lots of laughs.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: Arguing With Myself

programme.title: Maria Bamford: Local Act

programme.title: Maria Bamford: Weakness Is the Brand
programme.desc: Comedian Maria Bamford is back and subjectively better than ever! Weakness is her brand, so get ready to feel much better about yourself

programme.title: Maria Bamford: The Special Special Special
programme.desc: The comic performs for an audience consisting of only her parents.

programme.title: Greg Warren: Fish Sandwich
programme.desc: This nationally touring headliner has performed on Late Night with Seth Meyers, Last Comic Standing, Comedy Central Presents, BET, CMT and more.

programme.title: Nicole Burch: Mama Drama
programme.desc: Nicole Burch opens up about getting pregnant from a one-night stand with her friend Craig and how she’s managing to co-parent a toddler with him.

programme.title: Nicole Burch: Never Been Kissed
programme.desc: Nicole goes through the wringer with dating, until she meets her childhood crush: celebrity Michael Vartan. Will he break her unlucky-in-love streak?

programme.title: Dana Gould: I Know It’s Wrong
programme.desc: Dana Gould takes on the absurdities of modern life through a pop-culture obsessed lens. Unapologetic and off-the-wall funny, there's no middle ground in this comedy special filmed at the Neptune Theater in Seattle, WA.

programme.title: Jay Mohr: Altamont
programme.desc: Comedian Jay Mohr tackles subjects from unexpected visitors, bringing up children to working with Chris Farley on SNL in his new stand-up special.

programme.title: Jay Mohr: American Treasure
programme.desc: The popular comedian tells deeply personal stories from his fascinating life and presents his famously funny celebrity impressions and observations.

programme.title: Joey Coco Diaz: Sociably Unacceptable
programme.desc: It's been 25 years in the making and now Uncle Joey Diaz is at Seeso for his first socially unacceptable special. Prepare yourselves, savages.

programme.title: Tom Segura: Completely Normal
programme.desc: Radio, television and live performance veteran Tom Segura shares a few off-hand appraisals on hotels and hobbies with a cool and thoughtful demeanor.

programme.title: Jim Gaffigan: Quality Time
programme.desc: The comedian discusses why we aren’t honest about not wanting to attend events, lying to children, and so much more in this hilarious special.

programme.title: Jim Gaffigan: Noble Ape
programme.desc: The stand-up comedy star describes how his wife faced a medical crisis, and he attempted to hold down the fort for their five children.

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: Family Feud
programme.desc: Steve Harvey assumes the hosting duties for this daytime game show in which five members of one family are pitted against five members of another family. Each team's goal is to guess the results of audience survey questions. A player from each team initially faces off, answering the question to earn the chance to either pass or play. The winning family gets a chance to earn extra cash in a bonus round.

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It's apple harvest time, and Monty shares tips on what to do with windfalls before planting a container to give a colourful boost for winter insects. Plus, Adam Frost visits a designer who has overcome extreme weather and difficult terrain.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Frances Tophill is in her new garden and assessing the tomatoes in her upcycled greenhouse, while Rekha Mistry shares the successes and failures of her new vegetable garden. Plus, Errol Reuben Fernandes heads to a contemporary garden in Wakefield.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty replants his bearded iris in the Dry Garden, clears the greenhouse ready for winter salad crops and harvests quince. As part of his Cottage Garden revamp, he transplants a shrub to the orchard and shows how to save money by collecting seeds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With Halloween approaching, Monty takes stock of his pumpkins and squashes, plants up alpines and shows how to divide a large fern to create new plants. Meanwhile, Adam Frost and Advolly Richmond visit Hever Castle in Kent.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Longmeadow is in full bloom, but Monty Don is keen to remind viewers that there is still time to sow some late vegetables, demonstrating how easy it is to grow salad in a pot. It's time to give wisterias their summer prune. An expert, whose 252ft vine was in full flower just weeks ago, shows how she cuts back that summer growth. Meanwhile, Carol Klein has been out and about in Norfolk to revel in the bearded iris.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As roses herald the real arrival of summer, the jewel garden starts to show signs of the abundance of colour that is to come. Monty Don prepares to surround the courtyard garden with scented summer pots.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty begins the process of taking out plants which are in the wrong place and either moving or dividing others. He also gives advice on making leaf mould from fallen leaves and how to use it.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don takes a look at the use of pots and containers and revels in their versatility, practicality and potential and shows us how best to use them in our own gardens. Carol Klein returns to Stroud to see how the new gardeners are progressing.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels from Missouri to Chicago and then across to New York and Philadelphia. He begins his journey in a prairie, the original American flowering wilderness. Much of the prairie has disappeared but he meets a couple who have revived the tradition and enjoy showing it to him in full bloom.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty goes South to explore gardens of early independent America and learns how the history of this part of the country is still very much evident in the places and people he meets. He visits the famous garden where President Thomas Jefferson, one of America's founding fathers, enjoyed spending his time seeking out seeds and plants for his thousand foot vegetable garden.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty explores the extraordinary scenery of the west coast of America. He begins his journey in Arizona where he learns about cacti and marvels at the sight of them in the desert and in private gardens where they have replaced traditional plants and lawns.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Morocco, Monty discovers the wide variety of paradise gardens. He begins just outside the city of Marrakesh in an enormous royal walled meadow, The Agdal. From there he moves to the heart of the town where he comes upon a tiny garden where huge banana plants jostle with palms to create a secret paradise garden, a shelter from the busy world outside. And in another part of the city a rundown old palace has been turned into a stunning contemporary garden with a twist.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Turkey Monty is dazzled by an extraordinary display of the Ottoman Empire's favourite flower, the tulip, and learns of its sacred significance. Travelling further East to India he encounters a new type of spirituality in the tomb gardens of the Mughal Empire. Stunning mausoleums were set in vast gardens as places where an earthly king could enter a divine paradise.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty and the Gardeners' World team look back at the horticultural highlights from the latest series and celebrate the very best inspirational gardens and gardeners up and down the country.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It's the Easter weekend, which means extra time to get out and enjoy the garden. At Longmeadow, Monty plants out sweet peas for summer colour, gives advice on what to use for mulching borders and has plenty of ideas for jobs to get on with this long weekend. Carol Klein is at RHS Rosemoor to revel in the floral spring sensations that epitomise the season. In Scotland, JJ Chalmers explains how important his local park was in helping both his physical and mental rehabilitation.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: A celebration of the snowdrop, with a visit one of the world's largest collections, lovingly nurtured in a suburban back garden. Plus, Monty gives tips on what to do once they have finished flowering. Nick Bailey revels in the beauty of magnolias.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Join Adam Frost in his garden, where he will be giving tips on laying turf, planting succulents and adding perennial plants to his kitchen garden to grow as cut flowers. Joe Swift travels to Marwood Hill Gardens in Devon to explore plants that thrive in moist conditions.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don has left Longmeadow this week to explore the beautiful gardens at RHS Hyde Hall in Essex. He seeks inspiration from their amazing dry garden and discovers how they manage to keep their lawns looking pristine in such a hot summer.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty continues with his revamp of the Cottage Garden by planting bare-root roses. Meanwhile, Adam Frost visits a challenging garden built on an exposed slope in the Lake District.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is back at the helm, but this time in the garden at his own Herefordshire home - a place that he has lovingly nurtured for the last 20 years. With winter receding, Monty, Carol Klein, Joe Swift and Rachel de Thame are preparing for spring. As well as showing us round his garden, Monty lifts and divides snowdrops and sows beetroot and plants onions. Monty also prunes his apple trees and trims his shrub roses.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the winter draws to a close, work in the garden starts to step up gear. With the flowers and fruits of summer in mind, Monty Don gets going by planting pots of summer bulbs for colour and scent, passing on his secrets of success by using a variety of planting techniques. He also reveals plans for reinvigorating the area in his garden where perennials are planted. Plus, Carol Klein visits Glendurgan Garden in Cornwall.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: British summer time means that, from Saturday, we all have an extra hour to get out in our gardens in the evenings just as the early spring display is coming into its own. At Longmeadow, Monty Don introduces us to the coppice, a woodland area where his favourite flower, the primrose, is in bloom. As well as enjoying the seasonal colours of spring, it's time to plan the summer display. Monty sows sweet peas.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As April gets under way, Monty Don begins the process of reinvigorating his Jewel Garden where, over the coming months, he will be using plants which will give an evolving tapestry of colour over the seasons. Elsewhere, Carol Klein revels in the glory of one the world's most renowned camellia collections when she visits Mount Edgcumbe on the banks of the River Tamar in Cornwall.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Spring gets into its stride and Longmeadow is bursting into life. Monty Don prepares for the summer by direct sowing hardy annuals like nasturtiums and calendulas as well as planting barley to give a flush of golden colour in the summer months. Monty also introduces us to the walled garden, an intimate family space where he'll be doing some timely lawn repair. Carol Klein visits the Gibberd Garden in Harlow.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As spring gets well underway, Monty Don adds to his collection of fritillaries at Longmeadow with pot-grown plants, as well as sowing some from seed. He also recommends other wildflowers which would thrive in the garden. Carol Klein meets Matt Bishop, who explains why he is attracted to later flowering varieties of daffodils and Rachel de Thame shows a viewer how to get to grips with pruning an overgrown shrubbery.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty gets going on planting climbers for different aspects in his walled garden, recommending the best varieties to use for sun and shade. Carol Klein is at Glebe cottage taking inspiration from the nearby Devon hedgerows, and back at Longmeadow Monty begins replanting his jewel garden with perennials.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As May gets under way at Longmeadow, Monty Don turns his attention to his `dry garden', an area where the soil is particularly thin and baked by the sun. He recommends plants which thrive in these conditions. Meanwhile, Rachel de Thame visits the gorgeous gardens of Coton Manor in Northamptonshire, where the owner has planted inspirational combinations in unpromising areas.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Across the country `Gardeners' World' presenters, from their own gardens and homes, give advice and share their knowledge to enable people to get the most out of their gardens. For further inspiration, professionals, horticulturists and hobby gardeners provide fellow green-fingered enthusiasts with useful tips and suggestions, no matter the size of garden or level of expertise. Whether it is creating depth in a small, backyard garden or how to make the most of the latest spinach crop with homemade pesto, presenters prove that the possibilities are endless for any gardener and garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don explores some of Longmeadow's late-summer highlights and propagates a range of favourite plants for next summer and we meet an artist who has created a very special roof garden where creativity and colour collide.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty turns his attention to containers, planting them up for drama and summer colour in the jewel garden and showing us how to repot citrus plants. In Hampshire, Joe Swift meets the designer of an award-winning contemporary garden to explore the techniques and the plants she has used to seamlessly integrate both house and garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow Monty's focus is on summer when he plants up containers for colour in the Jewel Garden. He also turns his attention to overcrowded ornamental grasses which, now they are beginning to put on growth, need to be split and replanted. Continuing her search for finding the right plant for the right place, Carol takes a close look at why plants survive in the cracks and crevices of walls and gives her recommendations for garden plants that will thrive in similar conditions.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol Klein and Joe Swift are at Gardeners' World Live in Birmingham. Joe will be casting an expert eye over the spectacular show gardens, while Carol will be focusing on the delights of the floral marquee.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Starting his journey at the sole surviving garden of the 1600s, Levens Hall in Cumbria, Monty sets out to investigate what the gardens of this age would have looked like and what influenced and inspired their creation.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty bases himself at Rousham House in Oxfordshire, designed by one of the first practitioners of the landscape movement, William Kent. It has survived almost unchanged since its completion in 1741.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the extraordinary transformations that occurred throughout the 19th century. As a result of an expanding empire, scientific and technological innovation and social change, British gardens became more exotic, more colourful and more widely accessible than ever before.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his journey through Britain's gardening heritage by looking at how the nation's gardens have evolved over the last hundred years. He looks at the profound effect that two world wars had on the attitude to gardens and gardening.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: In Leyton, Tariq and Sairah want to turn their dumping ground of a back yard into a sumptuous award-winning garden, suitable for entertaining friends and family. Both have competitive jobs in the banking sector and are used to winning at work but when it comes to gardening, they don't know where to begin.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: One couple battle to turn a clay-clogged building site in Sussex into a piece of Portugal. Another tackle a forest of overgrowth in their new back garden in Cadeby. They are determined to create a productive space, something they have always wanted.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: A truck driver from Wakefield with a passion for flowers wants to create a perfect outside space for his girlfriend and burgeoning family, while in Swindon a widow wants to find the best way of turning her bleak patch of green into a cottage garden.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty travels to two corners of the country where the challenges he faces are very different. On the south coast he is presented with a front garden ravaged by salty winds, and in Snowdonia he helps a mountainside garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don makes a start on his new wild flower garden at Longmeadow and at last gets to taste the first new potatoes of the year. He also demonstrates how a radical chop of some border plants now can rejuvenate them for later in the season. Carol Klein celebrates a cottage garden favourite, the foxglove, and Joe Swift drops in on world renowned garden designer, Dan Pearson.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty turns his attention to his ornamental grass borders, Carol travels to Cheshire to view some heleniums, and Joe is treated to a Jamaican feast when he visits Moor Green Allotments in Birmingham.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty welcomes a special guest, the Duchess of Cornwall, to Longmeadow, where she shares her love of gardening. Nick Bailey visits Knoll Gardens and gives his tips on the tall perennials which give a burst of colour towards the end of the season.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don explores some of Longmeadow's late-summer highlights and propagates a range of favourite plants for next summer and we meet an artist who has created a very special roof garden where creativity and colour collide.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As roses herald the real arrival of summer, the jewel garden starts to show signs of the abundance of colour that is to come. Monty Don prepares to surround the courtyard garden with scented summer pots.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: By the first week of June, plants are growing with such speed that some have a tendency to flop. Staking is the answer. As well as sharing his tips, Monty Don shows how to make stakes that can be used for many years to come. Now the nights are guaranteed to be frost free, Monty plants out the tender annuals he's raised from seed.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don visits the iconic garden of impressionist painter Claude Monet at Giverny. As well as revelling in the beauty and colour of Monet's paradise at this time of year, he has a privileged chat to Englishman James Priest, who, just this week, took up his role as head gardener of this world-renowned garden. Back at Longmeadow Monty shares his top tips for growing key culinary herbs.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Muscle Car Dreamland and Elvis' Lincoln Continental
programme.desc: Tom Cotter finds a stash of muscle cars in Georgia before discovering an interesting Lincoln Continental that possibly belonged to Elvis Presley.

programme.title: Dream Collections with Chris Jacobs | The Amazing Collections of Harley Cluxton and Tom Malloy
programme.desc: Chris Jacob tours two unbelievable car collections. His first stop is with Harley Cluxton where they drive a Gullwing Mercedes and a Gulf-livery Ford GT. Next, Chris dives into some Indy 500 history with Tom Malloy and his amazing collection.

programme.desc: Larry Chen spends the day with YouTube and motorsport sensation Cleetus McFarland. Next, Larry heads to Spoon Sports to check out their heavily modified Honda Civic EG6.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | The amazing and unusual cars of the Lane Motor Museum
programme.desc: Tom meets up with Jeff Lane to get a private tour of basement collection in the Lane Motor Museum. Next, Tom goes hunting for barn finds near his home in North Carolina.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | Porsche Taycan GTS & Volkswagen ID. Buzz Review

programme.title: Capturing Car Culture w/ Larry Chen | Mitsubishi EVO 5, and Secret Car Collections
programme.desc: Larry Chen travels to Indonesia and discovers a unique twin-charged, 600HP Mitsubishi EVO 5. After that, Larry heads to Singapore to check out its vibrant car culture and explore a secret collection of cars spread across several properties.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | RARE Ford Country Squire Wagon & Rust-free finds in Arizona

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | 365-ft barn, Jaguar E-Types, and a Vintage SCCA Race Car

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Ferrari Dino, AMC Javelin, Buicks and Alfas
programme.desc: With the help of a friend, Tom discovers a cache of rare and forgotten cars hidden away in Virginia. Next, Tom visits two other friends to check out their interesting collections of cars.

programme.desc: Chip Foose puts pen to paper and reimagines the designs of the Nissan Z, Lamborghini Countrach, and Jeep Cherokee (XJ).

programme.desc: Cadillac Racing's historic return to the 2023 24 Hours of Le Mans.

programme.desc: Urban Outlaw Magnus Walker drives a 3-million mile Volvo P1800, goes racing in a Baja Bug, and drives two interesting cars that were never offered for sale in America.

programme.desc: In this episode of Barn Find Hunter, Tom Cotter gets exclusive access to Turner's Auto Wrecking in Fresno, California. After that, he heads high up in the Rocky Mountains of Colorado to discover a Porsche 356 and more.

programme.title: Ultimate Drag Race Replay | BMW vs. Tesla vs. Mercedes! Bentley vs. AMG vs. McLaren!
programme.desc: Jason Cammisa presents TWO episodes of his renowned Ultimate Drag Race Replay series. First, it's BMW M3 CS vs. Tesla Model 3 Performance vs. AMG C63 E Performance. Next , it's the Bentley Continental GT Speed vs. AMG GT63 vs. McLaren GTS.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Muscle Car Dreamland and Elvis' Lincoln Continental
programme.desc: Tom Cotter finds a stash of muscle cars in Georgia before discovering an interesting Lincoln Continental that possibly belonged to Elvis Presley.

programme.title: Dream Collections with Chris Jacobs | The Amazing Collections of Harley Cluxton and Tom Malloy
programme.desc: Chris Jacob tours two unbelievable car collections. His first stop is with Harley Cluxton where they drive a Gullwing Mercedes and a Gulf-livery Ford GT. Next, Chris dives into some Indy 500 history with Tom Malloy and his amazing collection.

programme.title: Capturing Car Culture w/ Larry Chen | Cleetus McFarland, Spoon Sorts, and Built By Legends
programme.desc: Larry Chen spends the day with YouTube and motorsport sensation Cleetus McFarland. Next, Larry heads to Spoon Sports to check out their heavily modified Honda Civic EG6.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | The amazing and unusual cars of the Lane Motor Museum
programme.desc: Tom meets up with Jeff Lane to get a private tour of basement collection in the Lane Motor Museum. Next, Tom goes hunting for barn finds near his home in North Carolina.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | Porsche Taycan GTS & Volkswagen ID. Buzz Review
programme.desc: Henry drives not one but two Porsches with a GTS badge on the back… and one will surprise you.Next, Henry jumps into the new Volkswagen ID. Buzz van and makes an attempt to turn it into a weekend camper.

programme.title: Capturing Car Culture w/ Larry Chen | Mitsubishi EVO 5, and Secret Car Collections
programme.desc: Larry Chen travels to Indonesia and discovers a unique twin-charged, 600HP Mitsubishi EVO 5. After that, Larry heads to Singapore to check out its vibrant car culture and explore a secret collection of cars spread across several properties.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | RARE Ford Country Squire Wagon & Rust-free finds in Arizona
programme.desc: Tom Cotter finds a factory "hot rod" 1 of 1 Ford Country Squire Wagon in suburban Detroit. Next, we find Tom near Lake Havasu in Arizona where the dry weather has been kind to cars left outside for decades.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | BMW E36 M3 and BMW M1
programme.desc: In this episode of Revelations, host Jason Cammisa tells you why the E36 BMW M3 is the one to have, even without a real M engine. And speaking of M cars... the back half of this episode features the amazing story of the first one, the BMW M1.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | 365-ft barn, Jaguar E-Types, and a Vintage SCCA Race Car
programme.desc: Tom meets up with an old friend in South Carolina who shows him a barn full of Jaguars and so much more. Next, Tom travels to New England where he finds a Sunbeam Alpine with SCCA race history and more.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Ferrari Dino, AMC Javelin, Buicks and Alfas
programme.desc: With the help of a friend, Tom discovers a cache of rare and forgotten cars hidden away in Virginia. Next, Tom visits two other friends to check out their interesting collections of cars.

programme.title: Chip Foose Draws a Car - Z-Car, Countach, and XJ Jeep Cherokee
programme.desc: Chip Foose puts pen to paper and reimagines the designs of the Nissan Z, Lamborghini Countrach, and Jeep Cherokee (XJ).

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | A Jaguar E-Type story, and What To Do With a Late Friend's Car Collection?
programme.desc: Tom Cotter hears some fun stories from the longtime owner of dilapidated Jaguar E-Type. Next, Tom meets a man who was made executor of his late friend's will. Specifically, he was tasked with managing his unique car collection.

programme.title: The Next Big Thing with Magnus Walker | E39 BMW M5 and Vintage Jeep Grand Wagoneer
programme.desc: Urban Outlaw Magnus Walker drives the E39 BMW M5 and a couple vintage Jeep Grand Wagoneers as he makes the argument as to why these vehicles might be The Next Big Thing in the collector car world.

programme.title: The Appraiser | 1969 COPO Camaro, 1969 Mustang Mach 1, and a 1969 Z/28 Chevy Camaro RS
programme.desc: Colin Comer starts this episode out with an original 1969 double COPO Camaro before moving onto a well-driven and well-loved 1969 Ford Mustang Mach 1. Next, Colin appraises a 1969 Chevrolet Camaro Z/28.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | Prodrive P25 Review and a Unique 2-Car Solution
programme.desc: Henry Catchpole reviews Prodrive's INSANE Subaru restomod, the P25.Next, Henry plays a little game of ""2-Car Solution,"" but with an interesting twist: two cars, same engine?

programme.title: Ultimate Drag Race Replay | Quickest Cars Under $35K! Plus: Demon 170 vs. Lucid Sapphire!
programme.desc: First up, Jason races the quickest cars money can buy... for under $35,0000. Next, he crowns the quickest American car EVER in a battle between the Dodge SRT Demon 170 and the Lucid Air Sapphire.

programme.title: ICONS with Jason Cammisa - Lucid Air, Ford Mach-E, Toyota GR86 and Ford Bronco Raptor
programme.desc: 4-episode block of the award-winning "ICONS" series with Jason Cammisa featuring the Lucid Air, Ford Mach-E, Toyota GR86, and Ford Bronco Raptor.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | 1 of 3 Santee SS, a "compact" Shelby GT500, dune buggies, and a Morris Minor Traveler
programme.desc: Tom Cotter finds a Santee SS with an aluminum block Buick V-8 engine, one of only 3 ever made. Next, Tom is introduced to a "compact" Shelby GT500 along with a plethora of other interesting barn finds.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | Renault R5 Turbo and Saab 900 Turbo
programme.desc: Early turbo cars! In this episode of Revelations, host Jason Cammisa tells us the unique stories behind the Renault R5 Turbo, and the Saab 900 Turbo.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Unimogs, Mercedes 190E 2.3-16 and starting up a barn find
programme.desc: Tom Cotter meets a long-time Mercedes mechanic and tours his collection of Unimogs and turbo diesel old Mercs. Next, Tom in is in the UK where he and a friend attempt to start a Morris Minor that hasn't run in over 20 years.

programme.title: MODIFIED - An Overland Porsche Cayenne and 2 Wild H1 Hummers
programme.desc: Matt goes behind the scenes at E-Motion Engineering and checks out how subtle but functional modifications can transform a Cayenne daily driver into a purpose-built escape mobile. Next, Matt jumps into 2 heavily modified H1 Hummers.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | AMG GT on Mercedes Secret Test Track, plus the new Porsche 911
programme.desc: Henry Catchpole heads to Mercedes' secret test track to drive and review the newest AMG GT. After that, Henry jumps in the new HYBRID Porsche 911 GTS (992.2) and wonders if the added weight will adversely affect the legendary nameplate.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat w/ Henry Catchpole | Unique Porsche 911s
programme.desc: Automotive journalist Henry Catchpole gets behind the wheel of pair of unique Porsche's. First, it's the legendary Heigo 911 rally car. Next, Henry drives the incredible Ruf SCR that "technically" isn't a Porsche at all.

programme.title: No Perfect Formula
programme.desc: Cadillac Racing's historic return to the 2023 24 Hours of Le Mans.

programme.title: Ultimate Drag Race Replay | Toyotas, BMWs, Nissans, Acuras and More!
programme.desc: This episode features THREE of Jason Cammisa's Ultimate Drag Race Replays. You'll see cars from BMW, Lexus, Toyota, VW, Hyundai and Acura.

programme.title: The Next Big Thing with Magnus Walker | 3M-mile Volvo, Baja Bug racing, and 2 cars America never got
programme.desc: Urban Outlaw Magnus Walker drives a 3-million mile Volvo P1800, goes racing in a Baja Bug, and drives two interesting cars that were never offered for sale in America.

programme.title: The Next Big Thing with Magnus Walker | Mercedes, Ferraris, and the BMW "Clown Shoe"
programme.desc: Urban Outlaw Magnus Walker drives a Mercedes 500SEC AMG, Ferrari F355, Ferrari 360, and a BMW M Coupe "Clown Shoe." Follow along as he makes the argument as to why these vehicles might be The Next Big Thing in the collector car world.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Tri-power Olds Super 88 and forgotten cars must GO!
programme.desc: Tom teams up with Davin Reckow, from our "Redline Rebuild" series, to unearth a large collection of forgotten classics, including an Oldsmobile Super 88 that gets a second lease on life after it's purchase and restored by a Barn Find Hunter viewer!

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | Caterham Super Seven 600 and a Famous Old Bentley
programme.desc: In part 1 of this episode of The Driver’s Seat, Henry Catchpole drives the new Caterham Super Seven 600. After that, he has the extraordinary opportunity to drive Eddie Hall's Derby Bentley. Eddie Hall was the only driver to ever complete the 24 Hour

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | Gateway Bronco and Alfaholics Giulia Super R 270 Restomods
programme.desc: Henry drives and reviews Gateway Bronco’s latest and greatest version of its Ford Bronco restomod, the Luxe-GT.Next, Henry jumps in a much different restomod: Alfaholics' Giulia Super R 270.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | $4M Barn Find Story - Rare Ferrari and 427 Cobra Hidden for Decades
programme.desc: Tom Cotter uncovers a barn find motherlode! Behind the doors of a condemned garage lies a rare Ferrari and a 427 Shelby Cobra that have been sitting for decades. This is the story of the find, removal, and auction of these amazing vehicles.

programme.title: Dream Collections with Chris Jacobs | Griot's Empire and Boo Boo's Garage
programme.desc: Chris Jacobs tours Griot's Garage which houses an amazing collection of vintage race cars. Next, Chris heads to Boo Boo's Garage where he finds and incredible collection of American classics.

programme.title: Capturing Car Culture w/ Larry Chen | Liberty Walk Ferrari F40, Tokyo Drift IRL
programme.desc: Larry Chen heads to Japan to check out Libery Walk's "blasphemous" Ferrari F40 custom build. Next, Larry explores the not-so-secret underground car meet right after the Tokyo Auto Salon.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | MST Mk1 Ford Escort and the Peugeot 205 GTI Tolman Edition
programme.desc: Henry Catchpole reviews the MST Mk1: Motorsport Tools' Ford Escort Mk1 restomod.Next, Henry jumps in another restomod, this time from Tolman Motorsport.

programme.title: ICONS with Jason Cammisa: Lucid Air, Ford Mach-E and Mustang GT
programme.desc: In this episode of ICONS, host Jason Cammisa talkes about why the Lucid Air is a time machine. Next, he directly compares the Ford Mach-E and the Mustang GT... and how they both stack up against the Tesla Model Y.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | Autozam AZ-1, Honda Beat, Suzuki Cappuccino, and Honda S500
programme.desc: In this episode of Revelations, Jason Cammisa explores the history of the legendary "A-B-C" Kei Cars. To wrap things up, he dives into the story of Honda's first-ever passenger car, the S500.

programme.title: Chip Foose Draws a Car - Classic Toyotas!
programme.desc: In this episode, watch as Chip Foose draws his creative take on the legendary Toyota FJ40 Land Cruiser.Next, Chip moves onto another Japanese classic from the same manufacturer, the iconic little sportscar: the Toyota MR2.

programme.title: The Appraiser | Larry Chen's R32 GT-R and Vin Anatra's BMW M3
programme.desc: Colin Comer welcomes Larry Chen and his R32 Nissan GT-R and offers his professional assessment of what it may be worth. Next, it's Hoonigan's Vin Anatra and his custom BMW M3 that goes under the microscope.

programme.title: Ultimate Drag Race Replay | The World's Quickest Cars
programme.desc: Lucid Air Sapphire vs. Bugatti Chiron Pur Sport vs. Tesla Model S PlaidLucid Air Dream Edition vs. Tesla Model S Plaid vs. BMW E39 M5 vs... a skydiver?Genesis GV60 vs. BMW iX xDrive50 vs. Ford Mustang Mach-E GT Performance vs. Tesla Model Y

programme.title: Capturing Car Culture w/ Larry Chen | Expensive Toyotas, and the #1 GT-R Restoration Shop
programme.desc: Larry Chen travels to Bogotá, Colombia, to visit a world-famous Toyota Land Cruiser shop, The FJ Company. Next, Larry reveals the magic behind Garage Yoshida, the world's leading Nissan GT-R restoration shop.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | RARE Hertz Shelby GT350, European Classics, and an all-original Datusn 240Z
programme.desc: Tom Cotter uncovers a rare Hertz Shelby GT350. Next, he explores an abandoned mine full of Porsches, Alfa Romeos and BMWs. Lastly, Tom talks with the owner of Datsun 240Z #00021 that sits in its original, unrestored condition.

programme.title: Patrick Dempsey Returns to Racing in "Back on Track"
programme.desc: "Back on Track" takes you behind the scenes of actor Patrick Dempsey's return to racing. Joined by longtime friend and fellow Porsche driver Patrick Long, the two Patricks race in the North America Porsche Endurance Challenge.

programme.desc: Automotive journalist Henry Catchpols's first look at the latest Bugatti hypercar

programme.title: TRP
programme.desc: YOU WON'T BELIEVE WHAT THESE FISH DO!! Dr. Mike Larkin is back! Join us for another exciting dive into the mysterious world of fish and learn some of the most shocking fish facts mother nature has to offer.This week, Dr. Larkin takes us on another exploration of the ocean's hidden wonders, unraveling fascinating insights into fish biology. From species that change gender to surprising revelations about their arterial systems, Dr. Larkin's expertise continues to shed light on these underwater marvels.For those who've followed Dr. Larkin's previous appearances, you already know how much you will get from this interview. And if you're new here, welcome aboard for an underwater adventure that will change the way you think about our finned friends.Don't forget to like, subscribe, and share this mind-blowing episode with fellow fish enthusiasts. Let's plunge into the depths of knowledge together!

programme.desc: Over a decade after the game changing Longbeard XR was introduced by Winchester, the wait is finally over for their next ground breaking turkey load. After years of perfecting the recipe behind the scenes, Winchester finally unveiled the new Longbeard TSS at a turkey camp in northern Michigan. First watch the jaw dropping Longbeard TSS pattern board testing, then see it go to work on some spring gobblers.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nestled in the hills of Ohio just west of the Appalachians is a very special deer camp ripe with memories from deer season’s past. With the development of the 350 Legend straight-walled cartridge by Winchester in 2019, a world of opportunities now existed in states like Ohio and Michigan. In this episode, with the 350 Legend in hand, three mature whitetails meet their maker, from the same blind, over the course of three seasons.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: It’s been 60 years since AA Tracker was introduced to the shooting sports world. Since that day, an immeasurable number of AA hulls have hit the ground and countless shooters have stood center stage raising a trophy where millions of dollars have been won. Professional and recreational shooters alike have trusted AA for six decades. In this episode, load up for stories of high school, collegiate competitors and the world’s best as they bust clays with the legendary shot shell.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: For the first time in history, the World English Sporting Clays Championship was held in the United States at the incredible M&M Hunting Preserve owned by the Matarese family in New Jersey. Watch as Winchester’s best shooters vie for Gold as they compete against over 2,500 shooters and 17 countries. We’ll also join the Kids and Clays foundation in Florida as they host an event that will most certainly touch your soul.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson closes out the half way point on the South America Waterfowl Slam. On just the third day of the hunt, he is able to take a Chilean Wigeon and a Rosy Billed Pochard which make species number 9 and 10 of the 20 on his list. Mark is still sharing the blind with Matt Gindorff, a WTA consultant, and they discuss waterfowl hunting in Argentina and how it compares to that of the U.S.

programme.title: Louisiana Catch and Cook
programme.desc: In this episode, Chef Jay Ducote brings along a very special fishing buddy, his dad, for our first-ever Catch & Cook freshwater adventure! We’re heading to the legendary Toledo Bend, famous for its sac-a-lait (Cajun for crappie) and ranked among the top bass lakes in the U.S. It’s a bucket-list stop for anglers everywhere, but trust us, the story doesn’t end with the fish.Steeped in Spanish, French, and Native American roots dating back to the Louisiana Purchase, this region serves up culture and flavor as rich as its fishing. We’ll be staying at Wildwood Resort, hitting the water with Captain Matt Loetscher of Living The Dream Guide Service, and capping off the day with spectacular lake views from their breezy lakeside bar.Hook, line, and sinker — you don’t want to miss this one!Ready to go catchin’ with one of Louisiana’s best captains? Visit www.LouisianaCharterFishing.com to check availability or book your trip today!

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: In this episode the DCD crew heads to the lesser-known but highly productive Red River in Western Louisiana. Despite a slow start to the season, the Red River provides some of the best hunting yet. With mixed bags of woodies, greenheads, and teal. Not to mention a handful of bonus squirrels and wild mushrooms. Shoot straight and come hungry.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: Duck hunting in Louisiana is as much about its history as it is about its future. In the season's final days, Jean-Paul learns about Louisiana’s rich waterfowling history, dives into conservation projects throughout the state, and returns to Bayou Black for one last ride. Shoot straight and come hungry because it's the last hunt of the season.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Ali and Rush head to the Bay Flats Lodge in Seadrift Texas to fish the vast shallow water marshes of the San Antonio Bay for Redfish. programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Ali and Rush head to Merritt Island, the sleepy space coast town where Ali was first introduced to fishing in Florida. Hoping to partake in a specialized fishery termed "fishing the other side," the guys will need calm weather, a serious boat, and a capable crew if they are going to have a shot at the yellowfin tuna that cruise the edge of the gulf stream current 100 plus miles off the coast.

programme.title: Local Knowledge

programme.title: TRP
programme.desc: YOU WON'T BELIEVE WHAT THESE FISH DO!! Dr. Mike Larkin is back! Join us for another exciting dive into the mysterious world of fish and learn some of the most shocking fish facts mother nature has to offer.This week, Dr. Larkin takes us on another exploration of the ocean's hidden wonders, unraveling fascinating insights into fish biology. From species that change gender to surprising revelations about their arterial systems, Dr. Larkin's expertise continues to shed light on these underwater marvels.For those who've followed Dr. Larkin's previous appearances, you already know how much you will get from this interview. And if you're new here, welcome aboard for an underwater adventure that will change the way you think about our finned friends.Don't forget to like, subscribe, and share this mind-blowing episode with fellow fish enthusiasts. Let's plunge into the depths of knowledge together!

programme.title: Flats Class

programme.title: Flats Class

programme.title: Flats Class
programme.desc: CA fishes with Richard Black in Islamorada. This guy can do it all. Rain or shine, no fish is safe.

programme.title: Beyond The Surface
programme.desc: On this episode Capt. Danny joins his good buddy and talented marine artist, Stephen Ferrell. The two of them take the 27’ DekKat to fish some of Stephen’s favorite paddle-board spots here in Melbourne, Florida. Tune in and see what they can make happen on a challenging weather day seeking the elusive Snook!

programme.title: Beyond The Surface
programme.desc: On this Episode, Capt. Danny takes a trip down to the historic Florida fishing village of Cortez. He’s paired up with local Commercial Fishermen Capt. Jarrod McKenzie for an action packed day chasing the Silver King!

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Over a decade after the game changing Longbeard XR was introduced by Winchester, the wait is finally over for their next ground breaking turkey load. After years of perfecting the recipe behind the scenes, Winchester finally unveiled the new Longbeard TSS at a turkey camp in northern Michigan. First watch the jaw dropping Longbeard TSS pattern board testing, then see it go to work on some spring gobblers.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nestled in the hills of Ohio just west of the Appalachians is a very special deer camp ripe with memories from deer season’s past. With the development of the 350 Legend straight-walled cartridge by Winchester in 2019, a world of opportunities now existed in states like Ohio and Michigan. In this episode, with the 350 Legend in hand, three mature whitetails meet their maker, from the same blind, over the course of three seasons.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: It’s been 60 years since AA Tracker was introduced to the shooting sports world. Since that day, an immeasurable number of AA hulls have hit the ground and countless shooters have stood center stage raising a trophy where millions of dollars have been won. Professional and recreational shooters alike have trusted AA for six decades. In this episode, load up for stories of high school, collegiate competitors and the world’s best as they bust clays with the legendary shot shell.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: For the first time in history, the World English Sporting Clays Championship was held in the United States at the incredible M&M Hunting Preserve owned by the Matarese family in New Jersey. Watch as Winchester’s best shooters vie for Gold as they compete against over 2,500 shooters and 17 countries. We’ll also join the Kids and Clays foundation in Florida as they host an event that will most certainly touch your soul.
Tarif Alkhatibs is new to Team200, but no stranger to killing someof the biggest free range whitetails in his home state of Texas –including the state record typical!

programme.title: Global Getaway
programme.desc: This week on Getaway; cruising the almighty Seine River through France, from Paris up to the battlefields of WWI. Enjoying the food and wine of the area, while learning about the history and experiencing the culture of this glorious region.

programme.title: Spring Thunder
programme.desc: Justin and Brandi with Big Dreams Outdoors finish up their slam hunting Merriam turkeys with 7J Outfitters in Wyoming. It was a tough week for Justin but persistence pays off!

programme.title: Beyond The Surface
programme.desc: Prepare to embark on an awe-inspiring aquatic journey as "Legendary Pursuits: Conquering the Depths of Port Saint Joe" takes you on an epic fishing adventure like no other. Join us as we cast off into the pristine waters of Port Saint Joe, a coastal paradise brimming with marine treasures waiting to be discovered.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoors

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson closes out the half way point on the South America Waterfowl Slam. On just the third day of the hunt, he is able to take a Chilean Wigeon and a Rosy Billed Pochard which make species number 9 and 10 of the 20 on his list. Mark is still sharing the blind with Matt Gindorff, a WTA consultant, and they discuss waterfowl hunting in Argentina and how it compares to that of the U.S.

programme.title: Louisiana Catch and Cook
programme.desc: In this episode, Chef Jay Ducote brings along a very special fishing buddy, his dad, for our first-ever Catch & Cook freshwater adventure! We’re heading to the legendary Toledo Bend, famous for its sac-a-lait (Cajun for crappie) and ranked among the top bass lakes in the U.S. It’s a bucket-list stop for anglers everywhere, but trust us, the story doesn’t end with the fish.Steeped in Spanish, French, and Native American roots dating back to the Louisiana Purchase, this region serves up culture and flavor as rich as its fishing. We’ll be staying at Wildwood Resort, hitting the water with Captain Matt Loetscher of Living The Dream Guide Service, and capping off the day with spectacular lake views from their breezy lakeside bar.Hook, line, and sinker — you don’t want to miss this one!Ready to go catchin’ with one of Louisiana’s best captains? Visit www.LouisianaCharterFishing.com to check availability or book your trip today!

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: In this episode the DCD crew heads to the lesser-known but highly productive Red River in Western Louisiana. Despite a slow start to the season, the Red River provides some of the best hunting yet. With mixed bags of woodies, greenheads, and teal. Not to mention a handful of bonus squirrels and wild mushrooms. Shoot straight and come hungry.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: Duck hunting in Louisiana is as much about its history as it is about its future. In the season's final days, Jean-Paul learns about Louisiana’s rich waterfowling history, dives into conservation projects throughout the state, and returns to Bayou Black for one last ride. Shoot straight and come hungry because it's the last hunt of the season.

programme.title: Monkey Trouble
programme.desc: Eva's (Thora Birch) mom (Mimi Rodgers) is obsessively neat; her dad's (Christopher McDonald) allergic to fur. But when a thieving organ grinder's (Harvey Keitel) monkey escapes, Eva bonds with a new friend. As much as she tries, Eva can't housebreak her new pet ... or break him of his training to steal. And Eva's getting the blame in this heartwarming family comedy.

programme.desc: During a summer in Nantucket, a recent high school grad with dreams of being a cartoonist helps a young singer save her family home from developers.

programme.desc: The battle between the good and the bad is bound to get ugly.

programme.desc: A maverick Cleveland cop with a turbulent past gets hand-picked by the DEA to infiltrate an international cocaine cartel in Los Angeles.
